title: Comparing Sizes and Lengths

vocab.definition: Having a lot of length from one end to the other
Having a little length from one end to the other
Having a lot of width from side to side

teachingNotes: Use real objects of different sizes. Practice comparing classroom items. Use vocabulary: bigger, smaller, longer, shorter.

sample.question: Which is bigger: an elephant or a mouse?
Show me something small in the room.
Which is taller: you or the table?

truefalse.question: A pencil is longer than a paperclip.
An ant is bigger than a dog.
A bus is shorter than a bike.
Your thumb is smaller than your hand.
expectedAny: thumbs are part of hands, smaller

truefalse.question: A ladder is wider than it is tall.
Baby animals are smaller than parent animals.

multiplechoice.question: Which is the smallest?
expectedAny: button is smallest of these objects

multiplechoice.question: Which animal is biggest?
expectedAny: horse is biggest of these animals

multiplechoice.question: Which is smaller than your hand?

fillintheblank.question: A mouse is _____ than an elephant.
A school bus is _____ than a car.
Your pinky finger is _____ than your thumb.
A basketball is _____ than a tennis ball.

shortanswer.question: Name something that is shorter than you.
What is the biggest thing you can see right now?
Name two things that are about the same size.
What is longer: your arm or your leg?
Find something wider than it is tall.
Name the smallest thing in your backpack.
What's the difference between big and tall?

wordProblems.question: Tom has a short rope and a long rope. If the short rope is 2 feet and the long rope is 5 feet, which rope is longer?
Sarah has 3 pencils. One is 4 inches, one is 6 inches, and one is 5 inches. Which pencil is shortest?
In the garden, the sunflower is 8 feet tall and the daisy is 2 feet tall. How much taller is the sunflower?
Mom buys a big pizza and a small pizza. The big pizza feeds 8 people and the small feeds 4. How many more people does the big pizza feed?
Jake has 5 toy cars. 2 are big and 3 are small. Are there more big cars or small cars?
A baby elephant weighs 200 pounds and an adult elephant weighs 8000 pounds. Which weighs more?
You have 4 sticks. Two are 3 inches long and two are 7 inches long. If you line up all the short sticks, how long is the line?
